summary: This bill, the High-Quality Charter Schools Act, amends the Internal Revenue Code to provide a tax credit for charitable donations made to eligible charter school organizations for the creation or expansion of charter schools. The credit equals 75% of qualified contributions, capped at the greater of 10% of the taxpayer's adjusted gross income or $5,000. The bill defines eligible organizations, sets a volume cap on the total credits, and includes provisions on expenditure requirements and organizational autonomy. It also sets forth an effective date of December 31, 2025 for the amendments.
